p: MSV causes maize streak disease, a major constraint of maize production in Africa [ 69]. Dominant and recessive natural resistance genes are available for protecting crops against MSV. Furthermore, engineered resistance to MSV is available in transgenic maize plants by expression of a defective form of a viral gene involved in viral replication [ 70] and was the first transgenic crop plant developed in Africa. A better transgene expression system activated only by MSV infection is under preparation [ 71].
